Bubble Sort.description: Repeatedly swap the adjacent elements if they are in wrong order.

Selection Sort.description: Repeatedly find the minimum element from unsorted part and put it at the beginning.

Insertion Sort.description: Insert each element from the unsorted list into its correct position in the sorted list.

Quick Sort.description: Divide and conquer algorithm. Choose a pivot and partition the array around it.

Merge Sort.description: Divide and conquer algorithm. Divide the unsorted list into n sublists, each containing one element.

Linear Search.description: Sequentially search through the list until the target element is found.

Binary Search.description: Divide and conquer algorithm. Search by repeatedly dividing in half the portion of the list that could contain the target element.

Dijkstra's Algorithm.description: Finds the shortest path between nodes in a graph.

A* Search Algorithm.description: Finds the shortest path between nodes in a graph by prioritizing nodes closest to the goal.

Convolutional Neural Network (CNN).description: A type of neural network commonly used for image classification and recognition tasks.

Recurrent Neural Network (RNN).description: A type of neural network that processes sequential data by using the output from previous time steps as input for the current time step.
